content: farrow-rib scarf by stefanie johnson an easy-to-knit scarf that lays flat with a cushy pleasing texture & a neat slipped st edge designed to match my farrow-rib hat mittens and socks farrow-rib contracts somewhat so a gauge swatch in farrow-rib is recommended to get the desired scarf width size 5 5 x 58 /14 x 147 cm easily adjusted gauge 24 sts & 26 row = 4 10 cm in farrow-rib farrow rib stitch pattern row 1&2 *k2 p1 repeat from * to end of row this stitch pattern equates to 1 column of knit sts 1 column of garter stitch and 1 column of purl sts repeated materials 120-200g worsted weight yarn shown above in valley yarns northampton 100% wool 247 yds 226 m /100 g 3 53 oz color 15 gold 2 skeins two 100g skeins will make a hat & scarf set u s 8 5 0 mm knitting needles darning needle instructions using the cabled cast-on method loosely cast on 33 sts or another multiple of 3 all row s1p wyf k1 p1 k2 p1 9 times * or until 3 sts remain k2 k1tbl *fewer/additional sets of k2 p1 is where the st count is adjusted if you cast on less/more than 33 sts continue until scarf measures 58 /147 cm or desired length bind off maintaining even gauge finishing cut yarn leaving a 6 / 15 cm tail wet block the scarf by soaking it in warm water with wool wash for a few minutes then pressing excess water out by wrapping it in a towel and squeezing dry the scarf flat weave in and trim yarn ends abbreviations used p purl k knit s1p wyf slip 1 stitch purlwise with yarn in front k1tbl knit 1 stitch through the back loop st s stitch es © settlers grove designs 2022 rev 2025 fiberfanny on ravelry settlersgroveinfo@gmail com 1 | p age please do not copy sell or distribute without designer s permission
